fields.name: Abilities:
fields.value:
- During the day, rig the vote. You control who everyone votes, and when. Anyone who has not voted may still appear to place a vote, but it will not actually count, while anyone who already voted will appear to switch their vote. 1 use.
- At night, interrogate and threaten a target. They are roleblocked (and they know that it was from a Bounty Hunter) and you learn their affiliation with your target (see attributes). Interrogating the same person twice may give a different outcome. 3 uses.

fields.name: Attributes:
fields.value:
- At the beginning of the game, you are assigned a target. This target will always be an evil factional head (randomized if multiple exist), or any evil faction member if no "head" role exists. You learn the role of your target.
- **Piercing** - You ignore *all* defense.
- You can read whispers. Additionally, you are roleblock immune.
- Interrogation messages are as such:
> "I've got nothing to do with them. I'd rather their head be gone." *If player must see your target dead to win and is not a REF member*

fields.name: Abilities (cont.):
fields.value:
> "We're the stronger group anyways, so good luck with your mission." *If player is part of an REF, but not the REF that your target is in*
> "I don't know who that is, but I don't really care." *If player is neutral towards your target (such as NBs)*
> "I'll never tell you anything." *If player is on the same REF as your target. Gain a use of second ability when this occurs.*
> "Alright, alright... you're looking for [Target Name]." *If player is on the same REF as your target, and second time targeting that player. Additionally, your target may choose to instead die to you and hide this message.*
> You found your target, so you killed them! *If player is your target.*

fields.name: Goal:
fields.value: Live to see your target dead *and* the Town lose.
